original: gnod pa dang ldan pa'i lus kyi las dang / yid kyi las mi byed pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: gnod pa dang ldan pa'i lus kyi las dang / yid kyi las mi byed pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: and do not engage in harmful physical and mental actions.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu; 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu; 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra, there are also great bodhisattva beings who, abiding in the six transcendent perfections,

original: sems can gyi don la rtag tu brtson pas /
analyzed: sems can gyi don la rtag tu brtson pas /
translated: are constantly dedicated to the welfare of sentient beings,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'dong zhing sems can rnams kyi ngan song gi lam gsum po rgyun gcod pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'dong zhing sems can rnams kyi ngan song gi lam gsum po rgyun gcod pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: and who, passing from one buddhafield to another, sever the three lower realms for sentient beings.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
translated: there are also great bodhisattva beings who, abiding in the six transcendent perfections,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te sems can rnams kyi bde ba'i yo byad thams cad nye bar sgrub cing /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te sems can rnams kyi bde ba'i yo byad thams cad nye bar sgrub cing /
translated: and prioritizing the transcendent perfection of generosity, provide all the requisites for the happiness of sentient beings,

original: zas 'dod @230b pa rnams la zas dang / skom 'dod pa rnams la skom dang / bzhon pa 'dod ba rnams la bzhon pa dang / me tog 'dod pa rnams la me tog dang / spos 'dod pa rnams la spos dang / phreng ba 'dod pa rnams la phreng ba dang /
analyzed: zas 'dod @230b pa rnams la zas dang / skom 'dod pa rnams la skom dang / bzhon pa 'dod ba rnams la bzhon pa dang / me tog 'dod pa rnams la me tog dang / spos 'dod pa rnams la spos dang / phreng ba 'dod pa rnams la phreng ba dang /
translated: to those who want food, they give food; to those who want drink, they give drink; to those who want vehicles, they give vehicles; to those who want flowers, they give flowers; to those who want incense, they give incense; to those who want garlands, they give garlands;

original: byug pa 'dod pa rnams la byug pa dang / mal stan 'dod pa rnams la mal stan dang / gos 'dod pa rnams la gos dang / rgyan 'dod pa rnams la rgyan dang / 'tsho ba 'dod pa rnams la 'tsho ba dang / khyim 'dod pa rnams la khyim gyis yongs su sdud cing 'tsho ba'i yo byad skyon med pa yongs su sgrub pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: byug pa 'dod pa rnams la byug pa dang / mal stan 'dod pa rnams la mal stan dang / gos 'dod pa rnams la gos dang / rgyan 'dod pa rnams la rgyan dang / 'tsho ba 'dod pa rnams la 'tsho ba dang / khyim 'dod pa rnams la khyim gyis yongs su sdud cing 'tsho ba'i yo byad skyon med pa yongs su sgrub pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: to those who want ointments, they give ointments; to those who want beds, they give beds; to those who want clothes, they give clothes; to those who want ornaments, they give ornaments; to those who want livelihood, they give livelihood; to those who want houses, they give houses, and they provide them with all the necessities of life without any difficulty.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
translated: in the same way, bodhisattva great beings, abiding in the six perfections,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te sems can rnams lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi sngom pa la rab tu 'god pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te sems can rnams lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi sngom pa la rab tu 'god pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: There are those who, having made the perfection of morality paramount, establish sentient beings in the restraint of body, speech, and mind.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
translated: there are also bodhisattva great beings who, abiding in the six perfections,

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te sems can rnams khro ba med pa dang / gnod sems med pa la rab tu 'god pa byed pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te sems can rnams khro ba med pa dang / gnod sems med pa la rab tu 'god pa byed pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: having made the perfection of patience paramount, establish sentient beings in the absence of anger and the absence of malice.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
translated: there are also bodhisattva great beings who, abiding in the six perfections,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te sems can rnams dge ba'i chos thams cad la mngon par brtson pa la rab tu 'god pa dag kyang yod do /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te sems can rnams dge ba'i chos thams cad la mngon par brtson pa la rab tu 'god pa dag kyang yod do /
translated: having made the perfection of perseverance paramount, establish sentient beings in the practice of all virtuous qualities.

original: @231a *// sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: @231a *// sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
translated: In this way, Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, abiding in the six perfections,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te sems can rnams zhi gnas rtse gcig tu bya ba dang / 'dod pa las dben pa la rab tu 'god pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te sems can rnams zhi gnas rtse gcig tu bya ba dang / 'dod pa las dben pa la rab tu 'god pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: make concentration the foremost, and establish sentient beings in the practice of one-pointedness and tranquility, and in the separation from desire.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
translated: in this way, Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, abiding in the six perfections,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba'i lus su mngon par sprul te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba'i lus su mngon par sprul te /
translated: make the perfection of wisdom foremost, and manifest bodies that are like the Tathāgata's body.

original: sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams dang / byol song gi skye gnas pa'i sems can rnams dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can rnams la ngan song thams cad las yang dag par 'da' ba'i phyir chos ston pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams dang / byol song gi skye gnas pa'i sems can rnams dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can rnams la ngan song thams cad las yang dag par 'da' ba'i phyir chos ston pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: There are those who teach the Dharma to the beings in the hells, to the beings in the animal realms, and to the beings in the world of Yama, in order to completely transcend all miserable realms.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
translated: in the same way, there are bodhisattva great beings who, abiding in the six perfections,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba'i lus su mngon par sprul nas shar phyogs kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu dong zhing sems can rnams la chos ston pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba'i lus su mngon par sprul nas shar phyogs kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu dong zhing sems can rnams la chos ston pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang /
translated: emanate bodies that are like the bodies of the buddhas and go to the buddhafields in the eastern direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, to teach the Dharma to sentient beings and to serve the thus-gone ones.

original: chos nyan cing byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong bar byed cing /
analyzed: chos nyan cing byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong bar byed cing /
translated: They also cause them to see the qualities of the bodhisattva saṅgha and the qualities of the buddha realms.

original: de dag @231b sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag gi mtshan ma yongs su bzung ste /
analyzed: de dag @231b sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag gi mtshan ma yongs su bzung ste /
translated: They take up the signs of those buddha realms.

original: de bas kyang rgya che ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po yongs su sgrub cing /
analyzed: de bas kyang rgya che ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po yongs su sgrub cing /
translated: They accomplish many buddha realms that are even vaster and more special than those.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshe gcig gis thogs pa sha stag skye bar byed pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshe gcig gis thogs pa sha stag skye bar byed pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: They cause bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are only impeded by a single birth to be born in those buddha realms.

original: lho phyogs kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu dong zhing /
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu dong zhing /
translated: They go to the south to as many buddha realms as there are sands in the Ganges River.

original: sems can rnams la chos ston pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / chos nyan cing byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong bar byed cing /
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos ston pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / chos nyan cing byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong bar byed cing /
translated: They teach the Dharma to sentient beings, serve the thus-gone ones, listen to the Dharma, and see the bodhisattva saṅgha and the qualities of the buddha realms.

original: de dag sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag gi mtshan ma yongs su bzung ste /
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag gi mtshan ma yongs su bzung ste /
translated: They take note of the characteristics of those buddha realms.

original: de bas kyang rgya che ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po yongs su sgrub cing /
analyzed: de bas kyang rgya che ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po yongs su sgrub cing /
translated: They then accomplish many buddha realms that are even vaster and more exalted than those.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshe gcig gis thogs pa sha stag skye bar byed pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshe gcig gis thogs pa sha stag skye bar byed pa dag kyang yod do //

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan par byas te dbang po gsal zhing yongs su dag pa dang ldan par gyur nas de dag lus yongs
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan par byas te dbang po gsal zhing yongs su dag pa dang ldan par gyur nas de dag lus yongs
translated: Thus, when bodhisattva great beings practice the six perfections, they attain the thirty-two marks of a great being and become endowed with clear and pure faculties.🔽

original: su dag pa de dag gis skye bo mang po'i dga' ba dang / mos pa bskyed de /
analyzed: su dag pa de dag gis skye bo mang po'i dga' ba dang / mos pa bskyed de /
translated: In this way, when bodhisattva great beings practice the six perfections, they attain the thirty-two marks of a great being, and they attain the clear and pure faculties. With those pure bodies, they generate the joy and faith of many beings.

original: de dag 'gro ba mang po'i snying du sdug cing yid du 'ong ba dang / sems can de dag kyang sems mos par gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid kyis mthar gyis @234a *//
analyzed: de dag 'gro ba mang po'i snying du sdug cing yid du 'ong ba dang / sems can de dag kyang sems mos par gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid kyis mthar gyis @234a *//
translated: They become dear and pleasing to many beings, and those beings, with that very root of virtue of faith in mind,

original: theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: eventually attain complete nirvāṇa through the three vehicles.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /

translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: ngag yongs su dag pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: ngag yongs su dag pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: They should train in the purification of speech.

original: yid yongs su dag pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: yid yongs su dag pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: They should train in the purification of mind.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa dag dbang po shin tu gsal ba thob nas de dag dbang po shin tu gsal ba de dag gis bdag mi bstod cing gzhan mi smod pa dag kyang yod
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa dag dbang po shin tu gsal ba thob nas de dag dbang po shin tu gsal ba de dag gis bdag mi bstod cing gzhan mi smod pa dag kyang yod
translated: “There are some great bodhisattva beings who, while practicing the six transcendent perfections, attain the very lucid faculties, and, owing to those very lucid faculties, do not praise themselves and disparage others.

original: do // sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: do // sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang po sems bskyed phyin chad /
translated: “There are some great bodhisattva beings who, from the time when they first begin to set their mind on enlightenment,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing phyir mi ldog pa'i sa ma thob kyi bar du nam yang dbul bar mi 'gyur zhing log par 'gro ba dang / ngan song du mi ltung ba dag kyang yod do //

translated: abide by the transcendent perfection of generosity and the transcendent perfection of ethical discipline, and, until they have attained the irreversible level, are never poor, and do not fall into error or into the lower realms.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

translated: “Śāriputra, there are bodhisattva great beings who, from the time they first begin to set their mind on enlightenment,

analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa ma thob kyi bar du nam yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi la ma mi gtong ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: never abandon the ten wholesome courses of action until they reach the irreversible stage.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /

translated: “Śāriputra,

translated: “Śāriputra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: “Śāriputra, there are also bodhisattva great beings who, while practicing the perfection of generosity and the perfection of discipline,🔽take on the status of a universal monarch and, while in that status of a universal monarch,

original: 'khor los bsgyur pa'i rgyal srid yongs su bzung ste 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal srid brgya stong du ma la gnas shing /
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur pa'i rgyal srid yongs su bzung ste 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal srid brgya stong du ma la gnas shing /
translated: make hundreds of thousands of universal monarchies their domain.

original: de dag la gnas nas sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma mnyes par byed de /
analyzed: de dag la gnas nas sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma mnyes par byed de /
translated: While in that status, they please hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la yo byad thams cad dang / mchod pa sna tshogs kyis rim gro dang / bkur sti dang / phu dud dang / mchod pa byed pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la yo byad thams cad dang / mchod pa sna tshogs kyis rim gro dang / bkur sti dang / phu dud dang / mchod pa byed pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: and they serve and venerate those buddha bhagavāns with all the necessities and various kinds of worship.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
translated: there are also bodhisattva great beings who, while practicing the six perfections,

original: sems can log par lta ba'i mun pa can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis snang bar byed pa dang / bdag nyid kyang nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs ma rgyas kyi bar du sangs rgyas kyi chos snang ba de dang nam yang 'bral bar mi byed pa dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: sems can log par lta ba'i mun pa can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis snang bar byed pa dang / bdag nyid kyang nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs ma rgyas kyi bar du sangs rgyas kyi chos snang ba de dang nam yang 'bral bar mi byed pa dag kyang yod de /
translated: They are those who illuminate the Dharma of the Buddha for sentient beings who are in the darkness of wrong views, and who never part from that illumination of the Dharma of the Buddha until they have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,🔽this is the origin of the Dharma of the Buddha

original: 'di ni / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi chos la @235a *//🔽yang dag par byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi chos la @235a *// yang dag par byung ba yin no //
translated: for bodhisattva great beings.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: therefore

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las rnams kyi go mi dbye'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las rnams kyi go mi dbye'o //
translated: when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they do not engage in physical, verbal, or mental actions that are accompanied by misdeeds.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Blessed One having said this, the venerable Śāradvatīputra said to him:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus kyi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus kyi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa gang lags /
translated: what is the bodhisattva great beings’ physical action that is reprehensible?

original: ngag gi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa gang lags /
analyzed: ngag gi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa gang lags /
translated: What is the bodhisattva great beings’ verbal action that is reprehensible?

original: yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa gang lags /
analyzed: yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa gang lags /
translated: What is the bodhisattva great beings’ mental action that is reprehensible?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di snyam du sems shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di snyam du sems shing /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings think like this:

original: 'di ni / lus yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni / lus yin gyi /
translated: ‘This is a body,

original: des ni / lus kyi las shig brtsam /
analyzed: des ni / lus kyi las shig brtsam /
translated: so it should perform a physical action.

original: 'di ni / ngag yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni / ngag yin gyi /
translated: This is speech,

original: des ni / ngag gi las shig brtsam /
analyzed: des ni / ngag gi las shig brtsam /
translated: so it should perform a verbal action.

original: 'di ni / yid yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni / yid yin gyi /
translated: This is the mind,

original: des ni / yid kyi las shig brtsam snyam na /
analyzed: des ni / yid kyi las shig brtsam snyam na /
translated: so it should perform a mental action,’

original: de ni / sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: de ni / sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las rtsom pa kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las rtsom pa kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The physical, verbal, and mental actions of bodhisattva great beings are accompanied by transgressions.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ni /
translated: bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: lus gang dang / ngag gang dang / yid gang gis 'jungs pa'i sems bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: lus gang dang / ngag gang dang / yid gang gis 'jungs pa'i sems bskyed pa'am /
translated: do not apprehend a body, speech, or mind through which they would give rise to a stingy mind,

original: tshul @235b khrims ngan pa'i sems bskyed pa'am /🔽gnod sems kyi sems bskyed pa'am /🔽le lo'i sems bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: tshul @235b khrims ngan pa'i sems bskyed pa'am / gnod sems kyi sems bskyed pa'am / le lo'i sems bskyed pa'am /
translated: give rise to a mind of bad moral discipline,🔽give rise to a mind of ill will,🔽give rise to a mind of laziness,

original: 'khrug pa'i sems bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: 'khrug pa'i sems bskyed pa'am /
translated: give rise to a mind of distraction,🔽or give rise to a mind of confused intelligence.

original: shes rab 'tshal pa'i sems bskyed par bya ba de lta bu'i lus mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shes rab 'tshal pa'i sems bskyed par bya ba de lta bu'i lus mi dmigs so //
translated: They do not apprehend a body,

original: ngag mi dmigs so //
analyzed: ngag mi dmigs so //
translated: they do not apprehend speech,

original: sems mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sems mi dmigs so //
translated: and they do not apprehend a mind.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe lus kyi gnas ngan len skyed pa dang / ngag gi gnas ngan len skyed pa dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len skyed pa tsam du ni /🔽shes par mi bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe lus kyi gnas ngan len skyed pa dang / ngag gi gnas ngan len skyed pa dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len skyed pa tsam du ni / shes par mi bya ste /
translated: “Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should not understand that the production of physical indisposition, the production of verbal indisposition, and the production of mental indisposition🔽are not bases.

original: de ni / gnas med pa'o //
analyzed: de ni / gnas med pa'o //
translated: They are not bases.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de ni / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe lus kyi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ngo //
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe lus kyi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ngo //
translated: it is because when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom they purify physical indisposition,

original: ngag gi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ngo //
analyzed: ngag gi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ngo //
translated: they purify verbal indisposition,

original: yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ste /
analyzed: yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ste /
translated: and they purify mental indisposition.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di ni / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lus kyi las kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lus kyi las kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
translated: this is the bodhisattva great beings’ physical action that is without fault,

original: ngag gi las kha ma tho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gi las kha ma tho ba med pa'o //
translated: this is their verbal action that is without fault,🔽and

original: yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
translated: It is the unblemished activity of the mind.🔽Śāriputra said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus kyi gnas ngan len sbyong ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus kyi gnas ngan len sbyong ba lags /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings purify the negative propensities of the body?

original: ngag gi gnas ngan len sbyong ba lags /
analyzed: ngag gi gnas ngan len sbyong ba lags /
translated: How do they purify the negative propensities of speech?

original: yid kyi gnas ngan len sbyong ba lags /
analyzed: yid kyi gnas ngan len sbyong ba lags /
translated: How do they purify the negative propensities of the mind?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽sh'a radva ti'i @236a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / sh'a radva ti'i @236a *//
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Śāriputra,

original: bu; gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus mi dmigs /
analyzed: bu; gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus mi dmigs /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings do not apprehend the body,

original: ngag mi dmigs /
analyzed: ngag mi dmigs /
translated: do not apprehend speech,

original: sems mi dmigs na /
analyzed: sems mi dmigs na /
translated: and do not apprehend the mind,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus kyi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ba yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus kyi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ba yin /
translated: at that time bodhisattva great beings purify the negative propensities of the body,

original: ngag gi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ba yin /
analyzed: ngag gi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ba yin /
translated: purify the negative propensities of speech,

original: yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ba yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ba yin no //
translated: and purify the negative propensities of the mind.”

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra said,🔽“Blessed One,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed phyin chad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs te gnas shing /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed phyin chad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs te gnas shing /
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra, from the time when the bodhisattva mahāsattva first generates the thought of awakening, he takes up and follows the path of the ten virtuous actions.

original: nyan thos kyi sems sam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sems sam /
translated: He does not generate the thought of the śrāvakas

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems bskyed ba med par de rtag tu rgyun mi chad par sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po'i sems nye bar gzhog na; de ni /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems bskyed ba med par de rtag tu rgyun mi chad par sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po'i sems nye bar gzhog na; de ni /
translated: or the thought of the pratyekabuddhas, but always and constantly directs his mind toward great compassion for all sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus kyi gnas ngan len dang / ngag gi gnas ngan len dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su dag pa zhes ngas bshad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus kyi gnas ngan len dang / ngag gi gnas ngan len dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su dag pa zhes ngas bshad do //
translated: I explain that this is the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s purification of the negative propensities of body, speech, and mind.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom

original: byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong zhing /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong zhing /
translated: cleanses the path to awakening

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: There are those who practice the perfection of generosity, the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence,

original: @236b bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: @236b bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: gsol ba / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol ba / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāriputra then asked, “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam gang lags /
translated: what is the bodhisattva great beings’ path to awakening?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,🔽“Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe nam lus la dmigs pa med pa dang / ngag la dmigs pa med pa dang / yid la dmigs pa med pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe nam lus la dmigs pa med pa dang / ngag la dmigs pa med pa dang / yid la dmigs pa med pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa med pa dang /
translated: they do not objectify speech, they do not objectify the mind, they do not objectify the perfection of generosity,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa med pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa med pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa med pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa med pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa med pa dang /
translated: they do not objectify the perfection of ethical discipline, they do not objectify the perfection of patience, they do not objectify the perfection of perseverance, they do not objectify the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa med pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa la dmigs pa med pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la dmigs pa med pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la dmigs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa med pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa la dmigs pa med pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la dmigs pa med pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la dmigs pa med pa dang /
translated: they do not objectify the perfection of wisdom, they do not objectify the vehicle of the hearers, they do not objectify the vehicle of the solitary buddhas, they do not objectify the vehicle of the bodhisattvas,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la dmigs pa med par gyur pa de ni /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la dmigs pa med par gyur pa de ni /
translated: The vehicle of the perfectly accomplished Buddha is without reference points.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam yin te /
translated: this is the bodhisattva mahāsattvas’ path to awakening.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad la dmigs pa med cing blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad la dmigs pa med cing blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa'o //
translated: In this way, all phenomena are without reference points, without acceptance, and without rejection.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub @237a *//🔽sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lam de lta bus pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing nan tan byed pa de dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub @237a *// sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lam de lta bus pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing nan tan byed pa de dag ni /
translated: bodhisattva mahāsattvas

original: sus kyang thub pa med do //
analyzed: sus kyang thub pa med do //
translated: who practice the six perfections and are diligent on this path cannot be defeated by anyone.🔽”

original: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāradvatīputra then asked,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul ji lta bur spyod pa rnams thub pa ma mchis pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul ji lta bur spyod pa rnams thub pa ma mchis pa lags /
translated: “Blessed One, how do bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice so that they cannot be defeated?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,🔽“Śāradvatīputra,

original: nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe gzugs la rlom sems med pa dang / tshor ba la rlom sems med pa dang / 'du shes la rlom sems med pa dang / 'du byed la rlom sems med pa dang /
analyzed: nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe gzugs la rlom sems med pa dang / tshor ba la rlom sems med pa dang / 'du shes la rlom sems med pa dang / 'du byed la rlom sems med pa dang /
translated: they do not falsely project feeling, they do not falsely project perception, they do not falsely project volitional factors,

original: rnam par shes pa la rlom sems med pa dang / mig dang gzugs la rlom sems med pa dang / rna ba dang sgra la rlom sems med pa dang / sna dang dri la rlom sems med pa dang / lce dang ro la rlom sems med pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la rlom sems med pa dang / mig dang gzugs la rlom sems med pa dang / rna ba dang sgra la rlom sems med pa dang / sna dang dri la rlom sems med pa dang / lce dang ro la rlom sems med pa dang /
translated: they do not falsely project consciousness, they do not falsely project the eyes and forms, they do not falsely project the ears and sounds, they do not falsely project the nose and smells, they do not falsely project the tongue and tastes,

original: lus dang reg la rlom sems med pa dang / yid dang chos la rlom sems med pa dang / sa'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / chu'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / me'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / rlung gi khams la rlom sems med pa dang /
analyzed: lus dang reg la rlom sems med pa dang / yid dang chos la rlom sems med pa dang / sa'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / chu'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / me'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / rlung gi khams la rlom sems med pa dang /
translated: they do not falsely project the body and touches, they do not falsely project the thinking mind and mental phenomena, they do not falsely project the earth element, they do not falsely project the water element, they do not falsely project the fire element, they do not falsely project the wind element,🔽they do not falsely project the space element, they do not falsely project the consciousness element,

original: nam mkha'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / mig gi khams la rlom sems med pa dang / @237b gzugs kyi khams la rlom sems med pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang /🔽rna ba'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / sgra'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / sna'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / dri'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / mig gi khams la rlom sems med pa dang / @237b gzugs kyi khams la rlom sems med pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / rna ba'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / sgra'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / sna'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / dri'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang /
translated: It is to be free of concepts of the element of space, the element of consciousness, the element of the eye, the element of form, and the element of visual consciousness.

original: sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / lce'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / ro'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / lus kyi khams la rlom sems med pa dang /
analyzed: sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / lce'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / ro'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / lus kyi khams la rlom sems med pa dang /
translated: It is to be free of concepts of the element of the ear, the element of sound, and the element of auditory consciousness; the element of the nose, the element of smell, and the element of olfactory consciousness; the element of the tongue, the element of taste, and the element of gustatory consciousness; and the element of the body, the element of texture, and the element of tactile consciousness.

original: reg bya'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / yid kyi khams la rlom sems med pa dang / chos kyi khams la rlom med pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang /
analyzed: reg bya'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / yid kyi khams la rlom sems med pa dang / chos kyi khams la rlom med pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang /
translated: It is to be free of vanity concerning the element of the mind. It is to be free of vanity concerning the element of mental objects. It is to be free of vanity concerning the element of mental consciousness.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la rlom sems med pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rlom sems med pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rlom sems med pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rlom sems med pa dang /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la rlom sems med pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rlom sems med pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rlom sems med pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rlom sems med pa dang /
translated: It is to be free of vanity concerning dependent origination. It is to be free of vanity concerning the perfection of generosity. It is to be free of vanity concerning the perfection of discipline. It is to be free of vanity concerning the perfection of patience.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rlom sems med pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rlom sems med pa dang / @238a *//
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rlom sems med pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rlom sems med pa dang / @238a *//
translated: It is to be free of vanity concerning the perfection of diligence. It is to be free of vanity concerning the perfection of concentration.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rlom sems med pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang /🔽stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / chen po stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rlom sems med pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / chen po stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang /
translated: It is to be free of vanity with regard to the perfection of wisdom. It is to be free of vanity with regard to inner emptiness, with regard to outer emptiness, with regard to inner and outer emptiness,🔽with regard to the emptiness of emptiness, with regard to great emptiness, with regard to ultimate emptiness, with regard to conditioned emptiness,

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang /
translated: with regard to unconditioned emptiness, with regard to emptiness that is beyond extremes, with regard to emptiness that is not beginningless and endless, with regard to emptiness that is not discarded,

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang /
translated: It is to be free of vanity regarding the emptiness of inherent existence. It is to be free of vanity regarding the emptiness of all phenomena. It is to be free of vanity regarding the emptiness of defining characteristics. It is to be free of vanity regarding the emptiness of nonobservation.

original: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la rlom sems med pa dang /
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la rlom sems med pa dang /
translated: It is to be free of vanity regarding the emptiness of things. It is to be free of vanity regarding the emptiness of the essential nature. It is to be free of vanity regarding the emptiness of the essential nature of nonthings. It is to be free of vanity regarding the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi la rlom sems med pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi la rlom sems med pa dang / @238b dbang po lnga la rlom sems med pa dang / stobs lnga la rlom sems med pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la rlom sems med pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi la rlom sems med pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi la rlom sems med pa dang / @238b dbang po lnga la rlom sems med pa dang / stobs lnga la rlom sems med pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la rlom sems med pa dang /
translated: It is to be free of vanity with regard to the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous ability, the five powers, the five strengths, and the seven aspects of awakening.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la rlom sems med pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la rlom sems med pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi la rlom sems med pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi la rlom sems med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la rlom sems med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la rlom sems med pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la rlom sems med pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi la rlom sems med pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi la rlom sems med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la rlom sems med pa dang /
translated: It is to be free of vanity with regard to the noble eightfold path, the four truths of the noble ones, the four meditative concentrations, the four immeasurable aspirations, and the four formless absorptions.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad la rlom sems med pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la rlom sems med pa dang / stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa la rlom sems med pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad la rlom sems med pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la rlom sems med pa dang / stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa la rlom sems med pa dang /
translated: It is to be free of concepts in relation to the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa la rlom sems med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la rlom sems med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams la rlom sems med pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la rlom sems med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la rlom sems med pa dang /
analyzed: smon pa med pa la rlom sems med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la rlom sems med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams la rlom sems med pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la rlom sems med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la rlom sems med pa dang /
translated: wishlessness, the superknowledges, the meditative stabilities, the dhāraṇī gateways, and the ten powers of the tathāgatas.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi la rlom sems med pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la rlom sems med pa dang / byams pa chen po la rlom sems med pa dang / snying rje chen po la rlom sems med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la rlom sems med pa dang /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi la rlom sems med pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la rlom sems med pa dang / byams pa chen po la rlom sems med pa dang / snying rje chen po la rlom sems med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la rlom sems med pa dang /
translated: and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rlom sems med pa dang / lan @239a *//
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rlom sems med pa dang / lan @239a *//
translated: It is to be free of pride regarding the result of stream enterer,🔽the result of once-returner,🔽the result of non-returner,🔽the state of a worthy one,🔽a pratyekabuddha’s awakening,

original: gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rlom sems med pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rlom sems med pa dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / rang byang chub la rlom sems med pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang /
analyzed: gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rlom sems med pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rlom sems med pa dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / rang byang chub la rlom sems med pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang /
translated: and the knowledge of path aspects.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rlom sems med pa dang / 'khor ba la rlom sems med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la rlom sems med par gyur pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rlom sems med pa dang / 'khor ba la rlom sems med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la rlom sems med par gyur pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /
translated: When they have no conceit about unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, no conceit about saṃsāra, and no conceit about nirvāṇa,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis rnam par 'phel ba yin te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis rnam par 'phel ba yin te /
translated: then those bodhisattva great beings have increased through the six perfections.

original: sus kyang thub pa med do //
analyzed: sus kyang thub pa med do //
translated: No one can overcome them.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas te thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas te thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
translated: in the same way, bodhisattva great beings standing in the six perfections bring to completion the knowledge of a knower of all aspects,

original: ye shes dang ldan pas nam yang ngan song rnams su mi skye /
analyzed: ye shes dang ldan pas nam yang ngan song rnams su mi skye /
translated: and because of that knowledge they are never reborn in the lower realms,

original: mi dbul zhing phongs pa rnams su myong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi dbul zhing phongs pa rnams su myong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: and they do not experience poverty and want.

original: lus gang dang ldan pas lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i nang na smad par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: lus gang dang ldan pas lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i nang na smad par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: They will not take on a body that is despised by gods, humans, and demigods.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatī­putra asked the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽de lta bu'i ye shes dang ldan pas /🔽byang chub sems @239b dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam yang ngan song rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur ba dang / mi dbul zhing phongs pa nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ba dang / lus gang dang ldan pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / de lta bu'i ye shes dang ldan pas / byang chub sems @239b dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam yang ngan song rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur ba dang / mi dbul zhing phongs pa nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ba dang / lus gang dang ldan pas /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽what is the omniscient wisdom that enables bodhisattva great beings to never be born in the lower realms,

original: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin gyi nang na smad par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de gang lags /
analyzed: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin gyi nang na smad par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de gang lags /
translated: to never experience human poverty and hardship, and to never take on a body that is despised by gods, humans, and demigods?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pas ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pas ni /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who has such knowledge

original: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyang mthong ngo //
translated: sees as many tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River in the eastern direction, in world systems as numerous as the sand particles in the Gaṅgā River.

original: chos kyang nyan to //
analyzed: chos kyang nyan to //
translated: He hears the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong ngo //
translated: He sees the bodhisattva saṅgha and the arrayed qualities of the buddha realms.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pas ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pas ni /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who has such knowledge

original: lho phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyang mthong ngo //
translated: sees as many tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River in the southern direction, in world systems as numerous as the sand particles in the Gaṅgā River.

original: chos kyang nyan to //
analyzed: chos kyang nyan to //
translated: He hears the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong ngo //
translated: he sees the bodhisattva saṅgha and the array of the qualities of the buddha realm.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pas ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pas ni /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who has that kind of wisdom

original: nub @240a *// phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: nub @240a *// phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyang mthong ngo //
translated: sees as many tathāgatas, arhats, and perfectly awakened buddhas as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River in the western direction, in world systems as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges River.

original: chos kyang nyan to //
analyzed: chos kyang nyan to //
translated: He hears the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong ngo //
translated: He sees the bodhisattva saṅgha and the array of the qualities of the buddha realm.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pas ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pas ni /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who has that kind of wisdom

original: byang phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyang mthong ngo //
translated: He sees the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas, as many as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River, in the northern world systems.

original: chos kyang nyan to //
analyzed: chos kyang nyan to //
translated: He hears the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong ngo //
translated: He sees the bodhisattva saṅgha and the array of the qualities of the buddha realms.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pas ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pas ni /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams mi dmigs so //
translated: but they do not apprehend the tathāgata powers.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi sgom ste /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi sgom ste /
translated: They cultivate the four fearlessnesses,

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams mi dmigs so //
translated: but they do not apprehend the fearlessnesses.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi sgom ste /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi sgom ste /
translated: They cultivate the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams mi dmigs so //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams mi dmigs so //
translated: but they do not apprehend the detailed and thorough knowledges.

original: byams pa chen po sgom ste /
analyzed: byams pa chen po sgom ste /
translated: They cultivate great love,

original: byams pa chen po mi dmigs so //
analyzed: byams pa chen po mi dmigs so //
translated: but they do not apprehend great love.

original: snying rje chen po sgom ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po sgom ste /
translated: They cultivate great compassion,

original: snying po chen po mi dmigs so //🔽sangs rgyas @243a *//
analyzed: snying po chen po mi dmigs so // sangs rgyas @243a *//
translated: but they do not apprehend great compassion.

original: kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad sgom ste /
analyzed: kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad sgom ste /
translated: They cultivate the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad mi dmigs so //
translated: but they do not apprehend the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu sgom ste /🔽rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu sgom ste / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mi dmigs so //
translated: They cultivate the result of stream enterer,🔽but do not apprehend the result of stream enterer.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu sgom ste /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu sgom ste /
translated: They cultivate the result of once-returner,
